title.narrative: Bridging the Gap: Inclusive policies and services for equal rights of persons with disabilities

description.narrative: Bridging the Gap is the first EU development funded project to focus on the rights of persons with disability in low and middle-income countries. The project duration is four years (2016-2020) with a budget of EUR 7 million. It is implemented in partnershi p with the European Commission the Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland three Member State development agencies (Austria Italy and Spain) one public foundation (FIIAPP) a network of European disabled persons' organisations (EDF) and a network of global disabled persons' organisations (IDDC).The project aims to support the implementation of the Convention of the Rights of Persons with Disabilities (CRPD) and the attainment of disability inclusive Agenda 2030. This is achieved through support to strengthen the capacity of Disabled Persons' Organisations as well as of governments in partner countries to implement the CRPD. The partner countries are Ethiopia Sudan Burkina Faso Ecuador and Paraguay.Finland is part of the project Steering Group that monitors im plementation and gives strategic guidance. Together with Austria Finland implements a country level component on inclusive education in Ethiopia therefore optimizing existing strong expertise and experience in the sector of inclusive education. In terms of financial support Finland co-funds Bridging the Gap by EUR 200000
